result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquavis T Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges to apply for work and child care. Credit for 0 days time served.

miscConds.notes: * Pay restitution in the amount of $500.00 to Family Dollar located at 7924 W. Burleigh Street, in the City of Milwaukee, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin, out of bail on deposit, if any; and the balance due prior to the end of the probationary period.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

* Pay the court costs, surcharges and assessments out of bail on deposit, if any; and the balance due prior to the end of the probationary period.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  No contact with ANY Family Dollar Stores during the period of probation.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and the Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction (HOC) with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and child care.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 Months with the following conditions:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  First, pay restitution in the amount of $500.00 to Family Dollar located at 7924 W. Burleigh Street, in the City of Milwaukee, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin, out of bail on deposit, if any; and the balance due prior to the end of the probationary period.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Second, pay the court costs, surcharges and assessments out of bail on deposit, if any; and the balance due prior to the end of the probationary period.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  No contact with ANY Family Dollar Stores during the period of probation.

Received and filed with the court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant Marquavis T Patterson in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Marquavis T Patterson in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/Sentencing Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant Marquavis T Patterson in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Awaiting discovery.  Status Conference scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Attorney Zoe Everett in court, defendant Marquavis T Patterson not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM
Case set for pre-trial conference.  Defendant is in custody in Walworth.  Defense counsel waiting for discovery and offer.  Defense requests more time.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  All parties are notified that effective 08-01-2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.
  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Program Status Update dated June 30, 2016; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Family Dollar- Burleigh St.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Marquavis T Patterson
Current: 4506 W. Hope Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 06-26-2016)
Prior: 5729 North 58th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marquavis T Patterson in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Defendant Marquavis T Patterson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rifelj, Branch 31.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
